info.title: SAP Emarsys Loyalty Contact API
info.description: The aim of the SAP Emarsys Loyalty Contact API is to help manage everything related to contacts in your loyalty program. The loyalty program allows you to award spendable loyalty points to your customers, based on their behavior on your website. Please note that version 2 of this API has been deprecated on June 2, 2023, and a more recent version 4 is out.

x-sap-shortText: The Loyalty Contact API helps you establish and run your customer loyalty program.

apikey.name: x-api-key
apikey.description: The security scheme of SAP Emarsys Loyalty API needs an API key named x-api-key to be sent in the request header the following way: `x-api-key: <key>`.

x-servers.description: SAP Emarsys Loyalty Contact API v4 base path

post.description: Join contact to loyalty program, create contact if required.

parameters.name: x-contact-id
parameters.description: The ID of the contact. Usually their email or your customer identifier. Make sure it's the same as what is always passed to Emarsys

parameters.name: x-plan-id
parameters.description: The ID of the plan as defined by the marketer.

500.description:
A GenericError is the default error message that is generated.
For certain status codes there are more appropriate error structures.

get.description: Get the contact's activity information based on their actions or purchases.

parameters.name: x-contact-id
parameters.description: The ID of the contact. Usually their email or your customer identifier. Make sure it's the same as what is always passed to Emarsys

parameters.name: x-language
parameters.description: The ISO identifier of the language in which to return the results. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes)

422.description:
A ValidationError is an that is generated for validation failures.
It has the same fields as a generic error but adds a Field property.

500.description:
A GenericError is the default error message that is generated.
For certain status codes there are more appropriate error structures.

delete.description: Deletes the contact including all their activities and rewards. IMPORTANT - This cannot be undone.

parameters.name: x-contact-id
parameters.description: The ID of the contact. Usually their email or your customer identifier. Make sure it's the same as what is always passed to Emarsys

500.description:
A GenericError is the default error message that is generated.
For certain status codes there are more appropriate error structures.

get.description: Pass the contact's Id (as identified by the shop, e.g. email, shop customer Id, ...) and get all their loyalty information.

parameters.name: withTierExpiration
parameters.description: Whether you need the tier expiration data. Send this parameter in the query string =true to get this data.

parameters.name: withPointsAllocations
parameters.description: Whether you need the details about points when they were accumulated and their expiration date. Send this parameter in the query string =true to get this data.

parameters.name: x-contact-id
parameters.description: The ID of the contact. Usually their email or your customer identifier. Make sure it's the same as what is always passed to Emarsys.

parameters.name: x-language
parameters.description: The ISO identifier of the language in which to return the results. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes)

500.description:
A GenericError is the default error message that is generated.
For certain status codes there are more appropriate error structures.

parameters.description: The ID of the plan as defined by the marketer.

For certain status codes there are more appropriate error structures.

post.description: Submit the referred friend's email and referralID to get a code to use at checkout which will earn them and the referrer their rewards.

parameters.name: x-referral-id
parameters.description: The referralID which is returned when getting a contact's referrals.

parameters.name: x-referral-email
parameters.description: The email address of the referred friend.

schema.description: Badly formatted or missing request data.

parameters.name: x-country

parameters.name: x-market
parameters.description: A string representing the target market for which to return the results.

put.description: Downgrade the tier which a contact is in. This can be any tier which is below the tier which the contact is currently in.

parameters.name: x-contact-id
parameters.description: The ID of the contact. Usually their email or your customer ID. Make sure it is the same as what is always passed to Emarsys.

parameters.name: x-reason-for-tier-change
parameters.description: A short reason why the contact tier was changed.

parameters.name: x-tier-id
parameters.description: The ID of the tier.

parameters.name: x-exit-to
parameters.description: What to do with the contact after tier removal

put.description: Upgrade the tier which a contact is in. This can be any tier which is above the tier which the contact is currently in.

parameters.name: x-reason-for-tier-change

parameters.name: x-tier-id

trait:validationError:422.description:
A ValidationError is an that is generated for validation failures.
It has the same fields as a generic error but adds a Field property.

schema.description: A ValidationError is an error that is generated for validation failures. It has the same fields as a generic error but adds a Field property.

trait:errorMessage:200.description: General Error Object. Sent with the appropriate HTTP code and contains an error message and a logId for locating the issue

trait:genericError:500.description:
A GenericError is the default error message that is generated.
For certain status codes there are more appropriate error structures.

schema.description: A GenericError is the default error message that is generated. For certain status codes there are more appropriate error structures.

exclusiveAccessDetails.title: exclusiveAccessDetails
exclusiveAccessDetails.description: Details about an exclusive access voucher.

accessURL.description: The URL that can now be accessed.

blockingEnd.description: indicates the time until when this URL can't be accessed and requires exclusive access (UTC time in milliseconds since unix epoch). For unlimited access, 0 is used.

blockingStart.description: If exists - indicates the time after which this URL will not be accessible and will require exclusive access (UTC time in milliseconds since unix epoch). For unlimited access, 0 is used.

validUntil.description: Indicates the time until when the URL can be accessed (UTC time in milliseconds since unix epoch).

activityTime.description: The time when the activity occurred (UTC time in milliseconds since unix epoch).

isForMember.description: Indicates whether this activity is for a member or non-member. Can be used to determine which text to show.

orderId.description: If this is an activity of type 'purchase', then this will have the orderId on the customer system.

status.description: The current status of the activity in the activity lifecycle.

type.description: The type of activity, such as 'purchase'.

groupActivityType.description: If this is a group activity, then it can be one of the following types: join, leave, no_change.

isFromGroup.description: Indicates whether this is a group activity.

isGroupActivityAboutThisContact.description: If this is a group activity, then whether or not the group activity is concerning this contact. e.g. if they are the one who joined the group.

contactAction.title: contactAction
contactAction.description: Single action available to a user

ctaButton.description: The text on the call-to-action button.

ctaUrl.description: The link the user is redirected to when the CTAButton is clicked.

fullIconPath.description: The full path to the icon representing this action.

minimumOrder.description: The minimum order value required for this action.

name.description: The name of the action matching the suite action name.

rewards.description: The reward for completing this action.

updatedAt.description: When this action was last updated (UTC time in milliseconds since unix epoch)

validFrom.description: Indicates the time from when this action is valid. Promotion actions start in the future.

validUntil.description: Indicates the time by which the action is valid.

externalLinkText.description: Text for the additional information link (commonly used for terms and conditions or product information).

externalLinkUrl.description: The URL of an additional information link (commonly used for terms and conditions or product information).

activityElements.title: activityElements
activityElements.description: The elements or sub-activities that make up the main activity.

activityTime.description: Indicates the time when the sub-activity occurred (UTC time in milliseconds since unix epoch).

isCanceled.description: If true, then the sub-activity cancels another activity. It can be used to show a strikethrough.

planName.description: Holds the plan name which the user was changed to, if relevant to the activity.

pointsType.description: The type of points received or removed when relevant.

tierName.description: Holds the tier which the user was upgraded/downgraded to, if relevant to the activity.

actionIcon.description: If this is a voucher from an event, then this field has the icon of the action that triggered it.

actionMessage.description: If this is a voucher from an event, then this field has the name of the action that triggered it.

code.description: If the voucher is redeemed, there will be a code in this field.

createdAt.description: Indicates when this voucher was created.

ctaButton.description: The text on the call-to-action button.

fullActionIconPath.description: If this is a voucher from an event then this field has the full path to the icon of the action that triggered this.

fullIconPath.description: The full path to the Icon representing this voucher.

id.description: The voucher Id used to redeem the voucher.

isExclusiveAccess.description: Indicates whether the voucher is for an Exclusive Access.

isRedeemed.description: Indicates whether the voucher has already been redeemed.

name.description: The name of the voucher as defined in the suite.

pointsRequired.description: The number of points required to redeem this voucher.

title.description: The title of the voucher, usually in bold, larger font.

updatedAt.description: Indicates when this voucher was last updated (e.g. redeemed - UTC time in milliseconds since unix epoch).

validUntil.description: Indicates the time by which this voucher can be redeemed (UTC time in milliseconds since unix epoch).

voucherSubType.description: Indicates whether this is a yearly voucher or one-time. Only valid for fixed-benefit vouchers.

voucherType.description: The type of the voucher (where it originated from).

wasAccessed.description: Indicates whether the voucher has been accessed already (at least once).

actionExternalLinkText.description: If this is a voucher from an event, then this field has the text for link to the additional information link (commonly used for terms and conditions or product information).

actionExternalLinkUrl.description: If this is a voucher from an event, then this field has the URL of an additional information link (commonly used for terms and conditions or product information).

externalLinkText.description: Text for the additional information link (commonly used for terms and conditions or product information).

externalLinkUrl.description: The URL of an additional information link (commonly used for terms and conditions or product information).

migrationOptions.title: migrationOptions
migrationOptions.description: Which items to migrate when changing plans.

redeemedVouchers.description: The vouchers which have already been redeemed.

contactVouchers.title: contactVouchers
contactVouchers.description: Holds all vouchers available to a user that can be redeemed, including those that have already been redeemed

vouchers.description: A list of all the vouchers which belong to this contact.

contact.title: contact
contact.description: The end user of the loyalty platform, the loyalty account holder

hasJoinedProgram.description: A flag indicating whether the contact has joined the loyalty program.

id.description: Unique identifier of the user, such as their userID, username or email. The same id must be used in all communications with the loyalty platform.

isActive.description: Indicates whether the contact is frozen or active and can continue taking part in the program.

isTierCalcTier.description:
This flag indicates whether the user is in this tier after the
periodic tier calculations i.e. if true, it indicates that they could
have dropped to this tier by not meeting periodically calculated tier
requirements.

joinDate.description: Indicates when the user officially joined the program. This may differ from the creation date.

planId.description: The planId of the loyalty plan that the contact is in

purchases.description:
The number of purchases the contact has made at the customer since
entering the current tier. This value goes to zero on every tier change.

groupName.description: If the contact is a member of a loyalty group, then this is the name of that group.

code.description: The voucher code to be entered at the customer's site

validUntil.description: Indicates the time by which this voucher can be redeemed (UTC time in milliseconds since unix epoch). This is typically used to decide whether to show the code or not (if expired).

contactActivity.title: contactActivity
contactActivity.description: Holds the history of the user's activities.

activities.description: A list of activities in descending chronological order.

contactActions.title: contactActions
contactActions.description: Holds the group of all actions available to a user which can earn them rewards.

points.title: points
points.description: A container for points and status points.

name.description: Plural points name as defined in the suite by the marketer. e.g. miles.

nameSingular.description: Singular point name as defined in the suite by the marketer. e.g. mile.

pending.description: Pending points that may transfer to the balance after validation.

status.description: Status points that go towards tiers.

pointsAllocations.description: Points breakdown, for each bunch of points, when allocated and when expiring.

tier.title: tier
tier.description: Holds Information about a specific loyalty level which a user is at

allowDropout.description: Whether this tier has a flag preventing dropping out of it at the end of the next year calculation.

fullIconPath.description: Full path to the icon for this tier.

points.description: Required status points for this tier.

entryAt.description: When the contact entered this tier - if this is the tier they are currently in.

expireAt.description: If the withTierExpiration parameter was true in the request, this will return when the tier is set to expire.

hasExpirationDate.description: If the withTierExpiration parameter was true in the request, this will return if the tier is set to expire.

tierType.description: The tier type. Can be Regular or Invite (invitation-only).

validationerror.title: validationError
validationerror.description: A ValidationError contains error/s that are results of validation failures. In some cases an array of several such errors can be returned for a single request.

genericerror.title: genericError
genericerror.description: A GenericError is the default error message that is generated. For certain status codes there are more appropriate error structures.

benefit.title: benefit
benefit.description:
A specific single benefit to contacts in this tier. This can be a purchase
benefit (from buying) or a fixed benefit (by virtue of being in a tier).

earningPointsRates.description: For purchase benefits there is a map which has the points earned by currency. The currency code is by the same ISO standard used in the x-currency parameter.

earningpointsrate.title: earningPointsRate
earningpointsrate.description:
Only applies to purchase benefits. This is a list defining how points are
earned by money spent at the customer.

pointsallocation.title: pointsAllocation
pointsallocation.description:
A container for allocated points which contains information about points
or points to spend which the contact received and when they will expire.

expireAt.description: Only returned if the points have an expiration date.

programsettings.title: programSettings
programsettings.description: The loyalty settings of a program as specified by the marketer in the lolyaty suite.

tiersbenefits.title: tiersBenefits
tiersbenefits.description: All benefits by virtue of being in this program, grouped by tier.

tiersbenefit.title: tiersBenefit
tiersbenefit.description: Information about the tier and a container for all the benefits of the tier sub-divided into purchase benefits and fixed benefits.

fixedBenefits.description: Benefits or perks that the user gets by virtue of being in this loyalty tier.

fromPoints.description: Required minimum status points for this tier.

fullTierIconPath.description: Full path of the icon for this tier.

purchaseBenefits.description: The points the user can earn by purchasing items at the customer

purchasesRequired.description: The number of purcahses required before the contact may upgrade if they meet all other requirements.

toPoints.description: The maximum points for this tier after which the contact may upgrade if they meet all other requirements.

error.title: errors
error.description:
This is a container used to provide detailed information about errors which occur in the API.
In some cases an array of several such errors can be returned for a single request.
Resource types:

      contact
      group

      error codes:
      1001 - resource not found
      1100 - contacts are from different loyalty plans
      2102 - contact is in a different plan
      2103 - contact is already in a different group
      2104 - contact is not in that group
      2105 - contact is in a group
      5000 - resource not valid
      5001 - already in process

errorCode.description: The error code for machine translation.

resourceName.description: The name of the resource to which the error relates.

resourceType.description: The type of resource to which the error relates.

contacts.description: The comma delimited list of contacts which are part of this group. These are the hashed Ids, not emails or other external identifiers. You can use the getContact endpoint to get more information about each contact.

createdAt.description: Indicates when this group was created.

id.description: Unique internal system identifier of the group.

name.description: Unique name of the group. Used as thenidentifier with all communications with the Loyalty API.

purchases.description: The number of purchases the group has made at the customer, since entering the current tier. This value goes to zero on every tier change.

name.description: Plural points name as defined in the suite by the marketer. e.g. miles.

nameSingular.description: Singular point name as defined in the suite by the marketer. e.g. mile.

pending.description: Pending points that may transfer to the balance after validation.

status.description: Status points that go towards tiers.

allowDropout.description: Whether this tier has a flag preventing dropping out of it at the end of the next year calculation.

fullIconPath.description: Full path to the icon representing this tier.

points.description: Required status points for this tier.

contactreferral.title: contactReferral
contactreferral.description: A referral that contacts can share with their friends, so that all of them can earn rewards when they buy using the referral code.

consentLinkText.description: The link text for the terms and conditions.

consentLinkUrl.description: The link to the terms and conditions.

consentText.description: The text shown preceding the terms and conditions link.

landingPageUrl.description: The referral landing page where the marketer would like the referrer's friends to land.

referralId.description: The referral id. Used to get the friend content and the referral code.

rewardText.description: The text of the reward that the referrer will receive.

subtitle.description: The referral subtitle as defined by the marketer.

text.description: The referral text as defined by the marketer.

title.description: The referral title as defined by the marketer.

contactreferrals.title: contactReferrals
contactreferrals.description: Holds the group of all referrals available to a user.

referralcode.title: referralCode
referralcode.description: The code to present to the friend of the referring contact, after they enter the email address. In some cases the code is not returned, since the marketer configured that it should not be shown, and is only sent via email.

code.description: The coupon code to present to the referring contact's friend.

displayCodeInClient.description: Whether or not to display the code to the friend (in addition to sending it via email).

expireAt.description: The date until which the coupon code is valid. This is typically used to decide whether to show the code or not (if expired).

minimumOrder.description: The minimum order value required for this referral.

consentLinkText.description: The link text for the terms and conditions.

consentLinkUrl.description: The link to the terms and conditions.

consentText.description: The text shown preceding the terms and conditions link.

ctaText.description: The text on the button used to submit the email.

fullRewardIconPath.description: The full icon path to the icon to be shown.

inputFieldPlaceholderText.description: The placeholder text inside the input component where the friend enters the email.

rewardText.description: The reward that the friend will earn.
